III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• During the time of the onsite audit there was no technical assistance provided.
2

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultant spoke with Chief Administrator about the potential of moving forward
with taking on a Juvenile Justice State Contract and reviewed the facility's current
approved program statement. The facility's program statement is already in
compliance with the ability to take JJ youth. Chief Administrator plans to keep this
consultant in communication about the potential of receiving this contract and any
additional support that may be needed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
-2024 Renewal: The most recent renewal inspection dated 02/06/2024 did not
produce any rule violations and as a result no Corrective Action Plan was
required.
Within this period of review the facility had eight special investigations and only
two resulted within Corrective Action Plans (CAPS):
- Special Investigation 2024SIC0001426 dated 06/07/2024 which found the facility
in non-compliance of a staff member not following the facility’s supervision policy
while on an outing. A Corrective Action Plan (CAP) dated 06/26/2024 was
approved that included the staff member involved having disciplinary action, the
supervision policy being updated to reflect that supervision cannot be through
glass, and all staff were trained on the updated policy. The facility successfully
completed all the action steps within their approved CAP.
- Special Investigation 2024SIC0001766 dated 10/25/2024 which found the facility
in non-compliance of a staff member not following the facility’s supervision policy
while on an outing. A Corrective Action Plan (CAP) dated 11/15/2024 was
approved that included the facility updating their procedure for outings to reflect
better planning and coordination for events, the facility updating their supervision
procedure to reflect global supervision of youth to better reflect practice, and all
staff will be trained on these updated policies and procedures. The facility is
currently complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor
CAP compliance where there are no noted concerns.
3

Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility’s
budget and the agency’s financial audit. The facility's 2024 financial audit will be
completed in April 2025, the 2023 financial audit was reviewed for this audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator report was submitted to this consultant on January 28, 2025,
and was reviewed. Chief Administrator noted a review of all the corrective action
plans that were implemented during this period of review which consisted of two
involving violations of staff not following the specific supervision policy. Chief
Administrator reported the impact of the corrective actions plans had a positive
impact on staff and noted staff appreciated the clarification and refinement in
regard to supervision and outing approvals.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff have reported they feel supported by their direct supervisors and their
administration team. They feel that they can always count on upper management
for support and to listen to their voice. Staff denied having any concerns at this time
about the facility.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The youth reported having a supported and trusting relationship with
staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on February 5, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
